clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Esketamine on Patients Undergoing Tumor Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Esketamine on Postoperative Pain, Anxiety and Depression in Patients Undergoing Tumor Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Although the acute and chronic postoperative pain of surgical patients has gradually been paid attention to, it has not yet been better resolved.and, the incidence of anxiety and depression in cancer patients is constantly increasing，The new analgesic anesthetic esketamine hydrochloride was launched in China last year，however, in the domestic and foreign literature, there are still few reports of esketamine hydrochloride in postoperative analgesia, and most of them are retrospective and small samples.This study aims to investigate whether esketamine has advantages over traditional opioids in terms of postoperative analgesia, anxiety and depression in cancer patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of moderate to severe pain
primary_outcome.description: Visual analog score is 4 points or more

secondary_outcome.description: Nausea, vomiting, lethargy, mental symptoms, etc.
PCIA usage（ml）, PCIA compressions（frequency）, remedial analgesia measures（Name and dosage of intravenous analgesics）
Ramsay sedation score（The score is 1-6 points, the higher the score, the higher the degree of sedation, the ideal sedation score is 2 points）

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Before operation), 24 hours after operation, 72 hours after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Hamilton Anxiety Scale（There are a total of 14 options. Each item is divided into 0-4 points according to the degree, and the score is 0-56 points. The total score is ≥29 points, which may be severe anxiety; ≥21 points, there must be obvious anxiety; ≥14 points, there must be Anxiety; more than 7 points, there may be anxiety; if less than 7, there are no anxiety symptoms.）

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Before operation), 24 hours after operation, 72 hours after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Hamilton Depression Scale（There are a total of 17 options, and each item is divided into 0-4 points or 0-2 points according to the degree. The total score is less than 7 points: normal; the total score is 7~17 points: there may be depression; the total score is 17~24 points : There must be depression; total score> 24 points: severe depression）
Sleep quality（Self-assessment by the patient, the score is 1-5 points, the higher the score, the better the sleep）
Chronic pain conversion rate（Follow-up one month after surgery, if there are still pain symptoms, it is chronic pain）

arm_group.description: After the operation, 5 mg esketamine was injected intravenously for postoperative analgesia. PCIA formula: hydromorphone 6mg + esketamine 45mg + tropisetron 10mg into 0.9% sodium chloride injection 100ml, the first dose is 20ug/kg , Background dose 2ug/kg/h, single dose 4ug/kg/time

After the operation, esketamine 2.5mg was injected intravenously for postoperative analgesia. PCIA formula: hydromorphone 6mg + esketamine 22.5mg + tropisetron 10mg into 0.9% sodium chloride injection 100ml, the first dose is 20ug/ kg, background dose 2ug/kg/h, single dose 4ug/kg/time
PCIA formula: 6mg of hydromorphone + 10mg of tropisetron into 100ml of 0.9% sodium chloride injection, the first dose is 20ug/kg, the background dose is 2ug/kg/h, and the single dose is 4ug/kg/time.

intervention.description: By adding different doses of esketamine to the postoperative analgesic pump, and the control group without adding this drug to observe the postoperative pain, anxiety and depression indicators of the surgical patients
